remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Hello, thank you for coming in today. I understand you’ve experienced right-sided weakness in your arm and leg as well as some difficulty with your speech. Can you tell me more about when these symptoms first began and how they have changed since then?

remedi_labels.value: right-sided weakness in arm and leg, difficulty with speech

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Um, hi. Yeah, the main thing is I started having this weakness on my right side—my arm and my leg. It kind of came on pretty suddenly, and it’s just not really getting better. That’s what’s worrying me the most right now.

Thank you for sharing that with me—I can understand why these symptoms would be concerning. In addition to the right-sided weakness, have you noticed any changes in your ability to speak or any difficulty with articulation, such as slurred speech or trouble finding words?

remedi_labels.value: Thank you for sharing that with me—I can understand why these symptoms would be concerning.

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Well, um... yes, I have noticed some changes with my speech. I think it’s called dysarthria? My words feel kind of slurred, and it’s harder to get them out clearly. That started around the same time as the weakness. Should I be worried about that?

remedi_labels.value: started around the same time as weakness
Should I be worried about that?

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can absolutely understand why you’d feel anxious about these symptoms—sudden changes like weakness and slurred speech are understandably alarming. In addition to the weakness and dysarthria, have you experienced any difficulty swallowing, such as coughing or choking when eating or drinking?

remedi_labels.value: I can absolutely understand why you’d feel anxious about these symptoms—sudden changes like weakness and slurred speech are understandably alarming.
coughing or choking when eating or drinking

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Yeah, actually... now that you mention it, I have had some trouble swallowing—dysphagia, I think you called it? It’s like, food and even water just don’t go down right, and I feel like I might choke sometimes. And, um, I’ve also been feeling kind of lightheaded off and on since all this started. Is that something I should be worried about too?

remedi_labels.value: Is that something I should be worried about

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’d be worried about these symptoms, especially with the combination of weakness, dysarthria, and difficulty swallowing. To help guide my assessment, can you describe whether the right-sided weakness has remained constant or if you’ve noticed any changes in the severity or distribution of this symptom since it began?

remedi_labels.value: right-sided weakness; changes in severity or distribution

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Let me think... The right-sided weakness has pretty much stayed the same since it started. I haven’t really noticed it getting better or worse—it’s just there, in both my arm and my leg. Actually, I’ve also had some blurred vision and dizziness along with everything else. I’m not sure if that’s related, but it’s been making symptoms a bit harder. I’m still hopeful this can get sorted out, but it’s definitely concerning.

Thank you for describing your symptoms so clearly—it helps guide my assessment. Regarding the lightheadedness and dizziness you mentioned, have you experienced any episodes of loss of consciousness or fainting since these symptoms began?

remedi_labels.value: Thank you for describing your symptoms so clearly—it helps guide my assessment.
episodes of loss of consciousness or fainting since lightheadedness and dizziness began

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Um, no, I haven’t actually fainted or lost consciousness since these symptoms started—just the lightheadedness and dizziness. But, well, I have had a headache that kind of comes and goes. And I’ve been having trouble ambulating—I just don’t feel steady on my feet, especially with the right-sided weakness. I’m still hoping this is something that can be treated, but it’s definitely making me nervous.

Thank you for sharing these details—it’s helpful for my assessment. You mentioned difficulty holding a spoon in your right hand; have you also noticed any changes in sensation, such as numbness or tingling, in your right arm or hand since the onset of your symptoms?

Yeah, actually—I couldn’t hold a spoon in my right hand at all, it just kind of slipped out. I don’t really notice numbness or tingling in my right arm or hand, but I do feel like the strength just isn’t there. I did notice some diminished sensation over the side of my right calf, though—not sure if that’s related.

Also, I’ve noticed my voice sounds different—deeper than usual, I think. Is that part of the dysarthria, or could it be something else? I’m just trying to understand what all these symptoms might mean together.

remedi_labels.value: couldn’t hold a spoon in right hand, weakness in right hand
no numbness or tingling in right arm or hand
diminished sensation over the side of right calf
Is deeper voice part of dysarthria or something else?
What do these symptoms mean together?

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Thank you for explaining your symptoms in detail—it’s helpful for my assessment. In addition to the right-sided weakness and difficulty with grip strength, have you noticed any involuntary movements, muscle stiffness, or changes in muscle tone in your right arm or leg during this period?

remedi_labels.value: Thank you for explaining your symptoms in detail—it’s helpful for my assessment.

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text:
Let me think... I haven’t really noticed any involuntary movements or muscle stiffness, but my right arm and leg just feel kind of heavy and weak. I guess I’m not sure about changes in muscle tone, but it’s definitely harder to move them, and sometimes they feel a bit floppy.

Also, I wanted to mention—I’ve had more trouble swallowing lately, and my family pointed out that my face looks a little droopy on the right side. Is that something you see too? I’m just trying to piece together if all these symptoms are connected. Should I be worried about this getting worse?

remedi_labels.value: heaviness and weakness in right arm and leg
droopy face on the right side
should be worried about symptoms getting worse

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’d be worried about these symptoms, especially with the new right-sided weakness and difficulty holding objects in your right hand. To help with my assessment, have you noticed any changes in your ability to feel touch, temperature, or pain on your right side compared to your left during your clinical examination or daily activities?

remedi_labels.value: difficulty holding objects in right hand
changes in ability to feel touch, temperature, or pain on right side compared to left

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text:
Yeah, actually... now that you ask, I have noticed some changes in sensation. Over the lateral aspect of my right calf, it feels kind of diminished—like I can’t feel touch or temperature as well as on my left side. I’m not sure about pain, but definitely touch and maybe temperature.

Also, during the exam, I think you might have seen that my right arm has a bit of a downward drift when I try to hold it up. That’s been pretty noticeable for me too. Sorry, I’m just—I get teary eyed talking about all this, it’s just a lot to take in. I’m still hopeful, but it’s hard not to worry. Is there anything specific I should be looking out for, or anything that would mean symptoms are getting worse?

remedi_labels.value: diminished sensation over the lateral aspect of right calf, decreased touch and temperature sensation
asking if there is anything specific to look out for or signs that symptoms are getting worse

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Thank you for sharing your experiences so openly—I can assess how difficult and overwhelming this must feel, and it’s completely understandable to feel emotional. Based on your symptoms—persistent right-sided weakness, difficulty holding objects in your right hand, facial droop, dysarthria, and sensory changes—my assessment is highly suggestive of a neurological condition, possibly a stroke affecting the left side of your brain. To further guide my evaluation, have you experienced any new or worsening symptoms such as sudden severe headache, vision loss, or difficulty understanding speech since your initial onset?

remedi_labels.value: neurological condition, possibly a stroke affecting the left side of the brain
persistent right-sided weakness, difficulty holding objects in right hand, facial droop, dysarthria, sensory changes
new or worsening symptoms such as sudden severe headache, vision loss, or difficulty understanding speech

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text:
Thank you for explaining symptoms so clearly. I appreciate you taking the time. Um, since all this started, I haven’t had a sudden severe headpain or lost my vision completely, but my vision has been kind of blurred at times. I haven’t really had trouble understanding speech, but it’s definitely been harder to get my own words out—like with the dysarthria.

I did want to mention again that the sensation over the lateral aspect of my right calf is still diminished—it just feels different compared to my left side. And my gait’s been really unsteady because of the weakness; I don’t feel comfortable walking away from the bed, and I definitely can’t stand on my right leg by itself.

Is there anything specific I should be watching for that would mean symptoms are getting worse? And, um, is this kind of presentation common with a stroke? I’m just trying to understand what’s happening and what to expect next.

remedi_labels.value: Thank you for explaining symptoms so clearly. I appreciate you taking the time.
diminished sensation over lateral aspect of right calf
not comfortable walking away from bed
cannot stand on right leg by itself
Is there anything specific I should be watching for that would mean symptoms are getting worse?
Is this kind of presentation common with a stroke?
I’m just trying to understand what’s happening and what to expect next.
